title: John Bonham
summary: John Henry "Bonzo" Bonham (31 May 1948 â€“ 25 September 1980) was an English musician and songwriter, best known as the drummer for the English rock band Led Zeppelin. Esteemed for his speed, power, fast single-footed kick drumming, distinctive sound, and feel for the groove,[1] he is regarded as one of the greatest and most influential rock drummers in history.[2][3][4]
